Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2011 08:14AM grandmotherextraordinaire wrote: Many years ago my late DH and I lived in the country and mornings were hectic getting to town for our jobs.   Half way to town I looked down at my feet.  One shoe on one foot and one fuzzy blue slipper on the other! It was too late to go back, but fortunately his folks lived in town and I had left a pair of shoes there.  It was not funny at the time, but we have sure laughed about it since. Mercedes

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2010 04:06AM grandmotherextraordinaire wrote: Please reconsider using minerol oil as a laxative.  My SIL's grandffather choked on it and died when it went into his lungs.  Nursing students were warned not to use it 50 years ago. What works for me is molasses.  Put about a teaspoon of molasses in your oatmeal for breakfast and it makes a natural soft stool happen in an hour or so. I know we are all different, but it is worth a try. Good luck. Mercedes.
